SMW Subobject for NormalHigh Alchemy value: 510Examine: Very decorative boots.Is members only: falseIs variant of: Decorative boots (gold)Uses infobox: ItemImage: File:Decorative boots (gold).pngWeight: 1.360Value: 850Version anchor: NormalRelease date: 2 December 2020Item ID: 25171

Decorative boots are boots available to free-to-play players from the Castle Wars Ticket Exchange shop. The players need at least 30 Defence to wear these armoured boots in the footwear slot. Their bonuses are equivalent to those of adamant boots.

Currently these boots provide the highest melee defensive bonuses on free-to-play worlds among all items worn in the footwear slot. They are also the only item in this slot that provides a strength bonus.

When unprotected upon PvP death, these boots will stay in the inventory, but will become broken and will require 5,000 coins to repair. However, if the death occurs beyond the level 20 of the Wilderness, the boots will be lost instead. In either case, extra 5,000 coins will be dropped upon death for the opponent.

After a regular death, the boots can be retrieved from the gravestone without a fee—unless the death occurs beyond level 20 of the Wilderness, in which case 5,000 coins will appear in the gravestone instead.

This item can be stored in the armour case of a costume room, as part of the Castle Wars armour (3) set. Ultimate Ironmen will be unable to retrieve individual pieces until the full set is stored.

'''Decorative boots''' are boots available to [[free-to-play]] players from the [[Castle Wars Ticket Exchange]] shop. The players need at least 30 [[Defence]] to wear these armoured boots in the [[footwear slot]]. Their bonuses are equivalent to those of [[adamant boots]].

Currently these boots provide the highest melee defensive bonuses on [[free-to-play]] worlds among all items worn in the [[footwear slot]]. They are also the only item in this slot that provides a strength bonus.

When unprotected upon [[PvP]] death, these boots will stay in the inventory, but will become [[#Broken|broken]] and will require 5,000 [[coins]] to repair. However, if the death occurs beyond the level 20 of the [[Wilderness]], the boots will be lost instead. In either case, extra 5,000 coins will be dropped upon death for the opponent.

After a regular death, the boots can be retrieved from the [[gravestone]] without a fee—unless the death occurs beyond level 20 of the Wilderness, in which case 5,000 coins will appear in the gravestone instead.
